reactor.netty.http.server

Class HttpRequestDecoderSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.netty.http.HttpDecoderSpec<HttpRequestDecoderSpec>
      • reactor.netty.http.server.HttpRequestDecoderSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Supplier<HttpRequestDecoderSpec>

    public final class HttpRequestDecoderSpec
extends HttpDecoderSpec<HttpRequestDecoderSpec>
    A configuration builder to fine tune the HttpServerCodec (or more precisely the HttpServerCodec.HttpServerRequestDecoder) for HTTP/1.1 or HttpServerUpgradeHandler for H2C.

    Defaults are accessible as constants

    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_ALLOW_DUPLICATE_CONTENT_LENGTHSfalse
    DEFAULT_H2C_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH0
    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_INITIAL_BUFFER_SIZE128
    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_MAX_CHUNK_SIZE8192
    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_MAX_HEADER_SIZE8192
    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_MAX_INITIAL_LINE_LENGTH4096
    HttpDecoderSpec.DEFAULT_VALIDATE_HEADERStrue
    Author:
    Simon Basl√©, Violeta Georgieva

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_H2C_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH

        public static final int DEFAULT_H2C_MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH
        The maximum length of the content of the HTTP/2.0 clear-text upgrade request. By default, the server will reject an upgrade request with non-empty content, because the upgrade request is most likely a GET request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
